de.pifpafpuf.web.html

Class Html

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.pifpafpuf.web.html.EmptyElem
      • de.pifpafpuf.web.html.Html

  • public class Html
extends EmptyElem
    is a node in an HTML DOM tree intended for HTML code generation. It always generates a close tag.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Html(String tagname)
      creates an HTML element for the given tagname.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(EmptyElem child)
      adds the given child element
      void add(HtmlText child)
      adds the given text as child element.
      Html add(String tagname)
      adds a child element for the given tagname and returns it.
      EmptyElem addEmpty(String tagname) 
      Html addEncoded(String text)
      like addText(java.lang.String) but the given text must already be properly HTML encoded, because on output with print(java.lang.Appendable, int) it is not encoded.
      Html addText(String text)
      adds a child element with the given text.
      Html addTight(String tagname)
      convenience method combining add(String) and setTight() for the generated child element.
      int getNumChildren()
      returns the number of child elements
      void print(Appendable out, int indent)
      appends the object's string representation to out, possibly using an indent of the given number of whitespace characters.
      Html setAttr(String key, String value)
      calls EmptyElem.setAttr(java.lang.String, java.lang.String), but returns this to allow fluent use.
      Html setTight()
      requests tight output of this HTML element.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • addText

        public Html addText(String text)
        adds a child element with the given text. When printed, the text will be encode as to not contain illegal characters like '<' and so on.
        Parameters:
        text - is the text for the child element.
        Returns:
        this

      • setAttr

        public Html setAttr(String key,
           String value)
        calls EmptyElem.setAttr(java.lang.String, java.lang.String), but returns this to allow fluent use.
        Overrides:
        setAttr in class EmptyElem
        Returns:
        this

      • addEncoded

        public Html addEncoded(String text)
        like addText(java.lang.String) but the given text must already be properly HTML encoded, because on output with print(java.lang.Appendable, int) it is not encoded.
        Parameters:
        text -
        Returns:
        this

      • add

        public void add(HtmlText child)
        adds the given text as child element.

      • add

        public Html add(String tagname)
        adds a child element for the given tagname and returns it.
        Parameters:
        tagname - name of the element to generate
        Returns:
        the generated child element

      • add

        public void add(EmptyElem child)
        adds the given child element

      • addEmpty

        public EmptyElem addEmpty(String tagname)

      • setTight

        public Html setTight()
        requests tight output of this HTML element. The children of this element are printed out inside the element's tags without any additional whitespace like line breaks and indentation. Tightness is inherited by all children.
        Returns:
        this

      • getNumChildren

        public int getNumChildren()
        returns the number of child elements

      • addTight

        public Html addTight(String tagname)
        convenience method combining add(String) and setTight() for the generated child element.
        Parameters:
        tagname - is the name of the generated child element
        Returns:
        the generated child element

      • print

        public void print(Appendable out,
         int indent)
           throws IOException
        appends the object's string representation to out, possibly using an indent of the given number of whitespace characters. Whether and where line breaks and indentation is used, is free to the implementing object.
        Overrides:
        print in class EmptyElem
        Parameters:
        out - is the stream to append the text to
        indent - must be used right after line breaks inserted
        Throws:
        IOException
